prereq.p: Transitions are triggered by different events depending on the widget from where it starts.

ul.li: From the Initial State widget, the pageflow ignition triggers the first Transition.
From a View State widget or a Sub-pageflow State widget, a user action triggers the associated Transition.
From a Decision State widget, the result of the executed action triggers the associated Transition.

prereq.p: Transitions respect design constraints, which are indicated as you work with Transitions in the diagrams.

step.cmd: In the Editor area, click on the state where the Transition starts and hold down the left mouse button while dragging the mouse to the state where the Transition ends.

stepresult.p: The Transition is added to the diagram.

step.cmd: In the Properties view pane, complete all fields (mandatory fields are indicated with an asterisk). For more information about how to complete this segment, refer to the section Transition properties.
On the menu bar, click File Save . Alternatively, on the toolbar, you can click .

stepresult.p: The Transition and its properties are added and saved.
